Which fast food places accept food stamps as payment?
In: Lifestyle › Dining Out › Fast Food
Rate This Answer
Jack-in-the-Box, Papa John's, Popeye's, Subway, El Pollo Loco and Domino's. Glancing at the complete list of EBT restaurants, you also see smaller stores like Louisiana Fried Chicken and Fish, Hong Kong Express and Wing Stop. Answered

Facebook Tweet Email Advertisement About Fast Food
''Fast food'' has become a regular part of people's vocabulary since the 1950's. The convenient, fast, and relatively cheap prices of fast food restaurants have made them some of the most popular stops for people on the move. Offering typical American foods like burgers, fries, and soft drinks, fast food restaurants have a definite American vibe and foothold.
More about Fast Food »
About Jack in the Box
''Fast food'' has become a regular part of people's vocabulary since the 1950's. The convenient, fast, and relatively cheap prices of fast food restaurants have made them some of the most popular stops for people on the move. Offering typical American foods like burgers, fries, and soft drinks, fast food restaurants have a definite American vibe and foothold.
More about Jack in the Box »
About El Pollo Loco
El Pollo Loco, SPanich for ''The Crazy Chicken,'' is a restaurant found in California, Arizona, Nevada, Texas, Colorrado, Illinois, Georgia, Connecticut, Oregon and Utah. Founded in Guasave, Mexico in 1975, El Pollo Loco's fresh chicken is marinated in a special recipe of herbs, spices and citrus juices that is passed down from the founding family. The chicken is flame-grilled, hand cut and served hot with warm tortillas and an assortment of side dishes.
